text: Aspergillus bicolor is a species of fungus in the genus Aspergillus. It is from the Aenei section. The species was first described in 1978.Christensen, M.; Raper, K.B.; States, J.S. 1978. Two new Aspergillus nidulans group members from Wyoming soils. Mycologia. 70:332-342 It has been reported to produce sterigmatocystin, versicolorins, and some anthraquinones. ==Growth on agar plates== Apsergillus bicolor has been cultivated on both Czapek yeast extract agar (CYA) plates and Malt Extract Agar Oxoid® (MEAOX) plates. The growth morphology of the colonies can be seen in the pictures below. Aspergillus_bicolor_cya.png|Aspergillus bicolor growing on CYA media Aspergillus_bicolor_meaox.png|Aspergillus bicolor growing on MEAOX media == References == bicolor Category:Fungi described in 1978
title: Aspergillus bicolor
